title: [K-12] Ethical Gamification-Based Social Studies Mobile Microlearning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts of gamification and foundational knowledge of social studies curriculum
context.additional_context: Design of Gamification Elements and Strategies to Minimize Negative Impacts in a Smartphone-Based Limited Technology Environment

learning_goals: Identify and explain at least three negative impact factors of gamification (e.g., novelty effect, excessive competition)

Within one week, learners will design a gamification framework for educational contexts (quiz battles or mission boards) applying 3 ethical principles (fairness, inclusivity, educational value) with 2+ concrete examples each (e.g., fairness—score calibration, inclusivity—multilingual support, educational value—concept-linked quizzes), achieving 80%+ compliance in peer reviews (2+ approvals out of 3) and teacher evaluations (4+ out of 5 rubric items).
Develop at least one gamification scenario optimized for mobile-based microlearning environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
